message: The validation technical components are present.
[Section C Check 1.a] A FedRAMP SSP must define its sensitivity level.

[Section C Check 1.a] A FedRAMP SSP must have an allowed sensitivity
                        level.

A FedRAMP SSP must implement a statement for each of the following lettered response points for
                        required controls: 
            .

The following 
            
            are required: 
            .
[Section C Check 3] A FedRAMP SSP must implement the most important controls.
[Section C Check 2] A FedRAMP SSP must implement all required controls.

[Section C Check 2] A FedRAMP SSP must not include implemented controls beyond what is
                        required for the applied baseline.
[Section C Check 2] Implementation status is correct.
[Section C Check 2] A FedRAMP SSP must have required response points.

[Section D Checks] Response statements have sufficient
                        components.
[Section D Checks] Response statement does not have a description not within a component.
[Section D Checks] Response statement does not have remarks not within a component.

[Section D Checks]
                        Response statement cites a component in the system implementation inventory.

[Section D Checks] Response statement has a component which has a required description
                        node.

[Section D Checks] Response statement component description has adequate
                        length.

[Section D Checks] Response statement component remarks have adequate
                        length.

[Section C Check 2] A FedRAMP SSP must define a responsible party with no extraneous
                        roles.

[Section C Check 2] A FedRAMP SSP must define a responsible party with no extraneous
                        parties.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation has a uuid attribute.
Every declared embedded attachment has a filename attribute.
Every declared embedded attachment has a media type.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation must have a uuid attribute.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation should have a title.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation must have a rlink element.

Every supporting artifact found in a citation should be
                        referenced from within the document.

A supporting artifact found in a citation should have an allowed attachment
                        type.
Every supporting artifact found in a citation rlink must have an href attribute.
A media-type attribute must have an allowed value.
A supporting artifact found in a citation should have an embedded attachment element.

A supporting artifact found in a citation must have only one embedded attachment
                        element.
Every embedded attachment element must have a filename attribute.
Every embedded attachment element must have a media type.
Every embedded attachment element must have content.

A
                        FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have the FedRAMP Master Acronym and Glossary attached.

A
                        FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have the FedRAMP Logo attached.

[Section
                        B Check 3.2] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have a User Guide attached.

[Section B Check 3.6] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have a Contingency Plan attached.
[Section B Check 3.7] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have a Configuration Management Plan attached.
[Section B Check 3.8] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have an Incident Response Plan attached.
[Section B Check 3.11] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have a Separation of Duties Matrix attached.

[Section B Check 3.1] A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a
                        policy document for each of the 17 NIST SP 800-54 Revision 4 control families.

[Section B Check 3.1]
A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a procedure document for each of the 17 NIST SP 800-54 Revision 4 control families.
[Section B Check 3.1] Policy and procedure documents must have unique per-control-family associations.

[Section B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP
                        must incorporate a Privacy Point of Contact role.

                        FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must declare a Privacy Point of Contact responsible party role reference.

                        B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must declare a Privacy Point of Contact responsible party role reference identifying the
                        party by UUID.

[Section B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP
                        must define a Privacy Point of Contact.

[Section B Check 3.4] A Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis
                        (PIA) qualifying question must have an allowed answer.

[Section B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have a privacy-sensitive
                        designation.

[Section B Check 3.4] A
                        FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question
                        #1.

                        FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question
                        #2.

                        FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question

                        FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question
                        #4.

[Section B Check
3.4] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have all four PTA questions.

[Section B Check
3.4] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have no duplicate PTA questions.
[Section B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP may have a SORN ID.
[Section B Check 3.4] This FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must incorporate a Privacy Impact Analysis.

A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must incorporate one or more FIPS 140 validated
                        modules.

Every FIPS 140 validation citation must have a validation
                        reference.
Every FIPS 140 validation citation must have validation details.
A validation reference must provide a CMVP certificate number.

A validation
                        reference must be in accord with its sibling validation details.

A
                        validation details must refer to a NIST CMVP certificate detail page.

A validation
                        details link must be in accord with its sibling validation reference.

[Section B Check 3.10] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must specify a FIPS 199
                        categorization.

[Section B Check 3.10] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must specify a security impact
                        level.

[Section B Check 3.10] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must specify an allowed security
                        sensitivity level.

[Section B Check 3.10] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must specify a confidentiality
                        security objective.

[Section B Check 3.10] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must specify an integrity security
                        objective.

[Section B Check 3.10] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must specify an availability security
                        objective.

[Section B Check 3.10] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must specify an allowed security
                        objective value.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must specify at least one information type.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP information type must have a title.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP information type must have a description.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP information type must have at least one categorization.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP information type must have a confidentiality impact.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP information type must have an integrity impact.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP information type must have an availability impact.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP information type categorization must have a system attribute.

A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP information type categorization must have a
                        correct system attribute.

A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP information type categorization must have at least one information type
                        identifier.

A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP information-type-id must have a SP 800-60v2r1
                        identifier.

A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP information type confidentiality, integrity, or availability impact must have a base
                        element.

A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP information type confidentiality, integrity, or availability impact must have a
                        selected element.

A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP information type confidentiality, integrity, or availability impact base or
                        select element must have an approved value.

[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have a Digital Identity Determination
                        property.

                        Digital Identity Determination identity assurance level property.

[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP may
                        have a Digital Identity Determination authenticator assurance level property.

[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP may have
                        a Digital Identity Determination federation assurance level property.

                        Determination property with an allowed value.

[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP should have an
                        allowed Digital Identity Determination identity assurance level.

[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP should have an
                        allowed Digital Identity Determination authenticator assurance level.

[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP should have an
                        allowed Digital Identity Determination federation assurance level.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must incorporate inventory items.

Every asset identifier must be
                        unique.
An asset type must have an allowed value.
A virtual property must have an allowed value.
A public property must have an allowed value.
An allows-authenticated-scan property has an allowed value.
is-scanned property must have an allowed value.
A scan-type property must have an allowed value.
A component must have an allowed type.
A component must have an asset type.
A component must have only one asset type.
An inventory-item has a uuid.
An inventory-item must have an asset-id.
An inventory-item must have only one asset-id.
An inventory-item must have an asset-type.
An inventory-item must have only one asset-type.
An inventory-item must have a virtual property.
An inventory-item must have only one virtual property.
An inventory-item must have a public property.
An inventory-item must have only one public property.
An inventory-item must have a scan-type property.
An inventory-item has only one scan-type property.

"infrastructure" inventory-item has
                        allows-authenticated-scan.

An inventory-item has
                        one-allows-authenticated-scan property.

"infrastructure" inventory-item has
                        baseline-configuration-name.

"infrastructure" inventory-item
                        has only one baseline-configuration-name.
"infrastructure" inventory-item has a vendor-name property.
"infrastructure" inventory-item must have only one vendor-name property.
"infrastructure" inventory-item must have a hardware-model property.
"infrastructure" inventory-item must have only one hardware-model property.

"infrastructure" inventory-item must have is-scanned
                        property.

"infrastructure" inventory-item must have only one
                        is-scanned property.

"software or database" inventory-item must have
                        a software-name property.

"software or database" inventory-item
                        must have a software-name property.

"software or database" inventory-item must
                        have a software-version property.

"software or database" inventory-item
                        must have one software-version property.

"software or database" inventory-item must have a
                        function property.

"software or database" inventory-item must
                        have one function property.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have a "this-system" component.

A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have a FedRAMP
                        system-id.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have a system-name.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have a system-name-short.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have a FedRAMP authorization type.
The System Owner role must be defined.
The Authorizing Official role must be defined.
The System Management PoC role must be defined.
The System Technical PoC role must be defined.
The System Other PoC role must be defined.

The Information System Security Officer role must be
                        defined.
The Authorizing Official PoC role must be defined.
A role must have a title.

One or more responsible parties must be defined for each
                        role.

Each responsible-party party-uuid must identify
                        a person.
Each person should have a responsibility.
Each implemented-requirement must have one or more responsible-role definitions.
Each responsible-role must reference a role definition.

Each responsible-role must be referenced in a system-implementation user
                        assembly.
Every user has a role identifier.
Every user has a user type.
Every user has a privilege-level.

Every user has a sensitivity
                        level.
Every user has one or more authorized privileges.
Each identified role must reference a role definition.
User type property has an allowed value.
User privilege level has an allowed value.
User sensitivity level has an allowed value.
Every authorized privilege has a title.
Every authorized privilege is associated with one or more functions performed.
Every authorized privilege title is not empty.
Every authorized privilege function performed has a definition.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP includes an authorization boundary.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP has an authorization boundary description.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP has at least one authorization boundary diagram.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP authorization boundary diagram has a uuid attribute.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP authorization boundary diagram has a description.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP authorization boundary diagram has a link.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP authorization boundary diagram has a caption.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP authorization boundary diagram has a link rel attribute.

Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP authorization boundary diagram has a link rel attribute with the value
                        "diagram".

A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP authorization boundary
                        diagram link references a back-matter resource representing the diagram document.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP includes a network architecture diagram.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP has a network architecture description.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP has at least one network architecture diagram.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP network architecture diagram has a uuid attribute.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP network architecture diagram has a description.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP network architecture diagram has a link.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP network architecture diagram has a caption.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP network architecture diagram has a link rel attribute.

Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP network architecture diagram has a link rel attribute with the value
                        "diagram".

A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP network architecture
                        diagram link references a back-matter resource representing the diagram document.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP includes a data flow diagram.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP has a data flow description.
A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP has at least one data flow diagram.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP data flow diagram has a uuid attribute.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP data flow diagram has a description.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP data flow diagram has a link.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP data flow diagram has a caption.
Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP data flow diagram has a link rel attribute.

Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP data flow diagram has a link rel attribute with the value
                        "diagram".

A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP data flow diagram link
                        references a back-matter resource representing the diagram document.

A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP declares the related FedRAMP OSCAL Profile using an import-profile
                        element.
The import-profile element has an href attribute.

Every implemented
                        requirement has an implementation-status property.
Planned control implementations have a planned completion date.

Every implemented requirement has
                        a control origin.
Every implemented requirement has an allowed control origin.
Every implemented requirement with a control origin of "inherited" references a leveraged-authorization.
Incomplete control implementations have an explanation.
Planned completion date is valid.
Planned completion date is not past.
A FedRAMP SSP must specify a cloud service model.

A FedRAMP SSP must specify an allowed cloud
                service model.
A FedRAMP SSP with a cloud service model of "other" must supply remarks.
A FedRAMP SSP must specify a cloud deployment model.

A FedRAMP SSP must specify an allowed
                cloud deployment model.
A FedRAMP SSP with a cloud deployment model of "hybrid-cloud" must supply remarks.

When a FedRAMP SSP has public components or inventory items, a cloud deployment model of "public-cloud" must be
                employed.
